content:
Then you must have a problem with edge. I don't use it, but I would not put it beyond Microsoft to hard code something in share to require outlook. They did it in the past with Word.

Having said that I cranked up Edge. found a web page, trolled through the three dot menu and then the more until I found share. I clicked in and got this

So I selected the default mail app

It opened the Thunderbird compose window with a link to the page in the body of the email. SO I guess it does work. Although it was looking for the default Mailto: handler so I suggest you check what that is set to in your installation of Windows.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
There are two "views of the message lists.

One is the old list view which has now been called table view. This is sorted by simply clicking on the date heading in the list. Each click reverses the sort order of messages in the list.

The second is the card view. This new feature has no heading so you have to use the File strip icon beside the Quick filter button

The menu offers a sort option.

This same menu can be used for the list view, but it is a number of extra steps to get the exact same result.

Each of these options is on a per folder basis and there is no option to change all existing folders globally.

You can change the default for new folder by modifying a preference in the Config Editor as discussed here https://support.mozilla.org/gl/questions/1422833.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I am sorry, but what Thunderbird password?

This https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

That is a per profile thing so it is not really going to e used across two different machines.

Or do you mean passwords stored in the password manager https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

In which case this probably applies.https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-receive-messages
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Per Outlook.com, se non lo hai già fatto, devi: - passare ad Oauth come metodo di autenticazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/autenticazione-oauth-microsoft-thunderbird-2023 - verificare che i server configurati siano aggiorni -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/autenticazione-oauth-microsoft-thunderbird-2023

Per l'altro account non saprei.
creator: @next

content: Si, ci sono segnalazioni aperte su questi problemi. Dovrebbero essere risolte nelle prossime versioni. Prova se in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi ottieni un comportamento più fluido -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-provvisoria-thunderbird
creator: @next

content:
Per Gmail su Thunderbird puoi seguire questa guida -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail

Thunderbird può gestire un numero illimitato di account anche dello stesso fornitore. Tuttavia Google può limitare il numero di account associati ad uno stesso client (attualmente il limite parrebbe essere di 10 account).
creator: @next
